title: Web Developer bei ADF International Austria gemein- nützige GmbH | karriere.at
text: Everyone says they want to change the world. We're looking for people who actually will. Web Developer Vienna, Austria | International Team | Full-time Everyone says they want to change the world. We're looking for people who actually will. ADF International is a faith-based legal advocacy organization that protects fundamental freedoms and promotes the inherent dignity of all people.  Please visit our career site to view our Statement of Faith and Doctrinal Distinctives.Web DeveloperADF International is looking for a highly problem-solving oriented Web Developer to join us in our Vienna, Austria office. As Web Developer, you are a vital part of the Development Team of ADF International. In this role, you will report to the Digital Development Specialist and will take the lead on development of the digital infrastructure for the organisation. ADF International is a fast growing team, this position is an exciting opportunity to start to work with us.Your Essential Responsibilities:In this position, you will:Be responsible for the backend and frontend architectureGood understanding of website performance (web vitals) and its impact on lead generation, UX and SEO.Experience using APIs to connect applications such as a CMS and analytics.Support day-to-day website content update requests from different stakeholdersImplement website layout/user interfaces by using standard HTML/CSS practicesConduct concept and usability testing and feedbackConduct QA and testing, site enhancements and bugs and leverage experience and data to provide solutions to resolve themWork with internal teams to ensure seamless analytics can be deliveredWork alongside digital designers for user interface and user experience featuresProvide holistic roadmap of infrastructural development of our website environment in view of evolving strategic needsWorking alongside the Development team to execute projects from conception to launch;Stay up to date of developments in web applications and programming languages.Perform website administrative tasks such as plugin updates, GDPR compliance, data archiving, user maintenance and security updates.Optimize SEO for our websitesOther Responsibilities:You will be asked to perform related duties or special projects as assigned.Skills You Need to Succeed:Experience in website infrastructure development in Wordpress and WP Engine is a mustOther web content management system experience will be a great assetGood knowledge in Rest APIs, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScriptComfortable using GITAbility to build and maintain Wordpress plugins and themes from conception to launchExperience in data analytic setup for websites such as google analytics and tag manager is a plus;Experience of implementing multilingual websites is preferable, as well as experience with WPML.Ability to communicate technical language to other team members in an articulate wayExcellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Understanding the importance of frontend user experience/user interface (UX/UI) designKnowledge of search engine optimization (SEO)Have strong personal and time-management skillsBe able to hold information in confidence and build trust with those around you;Be able to think strategically and innovatively;Be able to quickly problem-solve in potentially stressful situations;Have a strong attention to detail;Excellent verbal communication skills.Ability to:Fluently speak and write in EnglishAdditional communication skills in German is a plusEducation and/or experience:EssentialBachelors degree in relevant field or equivalent qualification;Ideally, two or more years of relevant experience. Work permit for Austria or EU citizenship required. ADF International Austria gemeinnützige GmbH contact@adfinternational.org

title: Support Engineer (f/m/d) bei DIMOCO Payments GmbH | karriere.at
text:
DIMOCO, founded in 2000, is a regulated payment company and holds a payment service license from the Austrian Financial Market Authority (FMA). DIMOCO Payments GmbH enables merchants to accept payment for digital and non-digital goods by providing a robust and flexible APIs, connecting consumers to payment methods in the European Economic Area (EEA) and worldwide. One single DIMOCO contract now connects merchants to over 100 payment methods, including credit cards and carrier billing, for advanced eCommerce and mCommerce. In our international team from 20+ nations, you can expect plenty of room for your personal touch and personal responsibility. Flexible working hours and home office options support your work-life balance. If you see yourself as an important part of a motivated team in a modern environment, then you are right with us! To strengthen our dynamic and growing team, we are looking for a tech-savvy and communicative Support Engineer (f/m/d) Your vital roleYou don't feel like standing still? Then DIMOCO is the right place for you!We are looking for a dynamic personality with the will to develop and succeed.In this responsible role you will handle all customer communications clearly, professionally and in due time via phone and email. We will trust you withOffering support and assisting merchants in troubleshooting issuesTracking all request and incidents in a Jira ticketing systemChecking configurations and merchant setups in the DIMOCO production systemsWorking closely with the Service Implementation, Operations and Development teamsMaintaining a support knowledge baseGenerating complaint and issue reportsYour expertise includes2 or more years of IT experience in a similar positionGeneral database knowledge with basic SQLDebugging log files on Linux based systemsBasic Java knowledgeBasic IT Network knowledgeVery good social, communication and coordination skillsGood English, German is a plusStructured and active approach to troubleshootingFamiliarity with payment services environment and systems (PSP gateway, Card payments, PCI, etc.) is considered an advantageWe also encourage applications of techy-savvy people, who have been working in another field with high interest in an IT-based environmentDIMOCOs promiseYou can expect international development opportunities in the growing and forward-looking payments industryA varied, challenging and international taskYou will receive comprehensive training in our products and systemsFlexible working hours and home office options are important to you? Let's talk about it!At least before the COVID 19 pandemic, the DIMOCO employee events were legendaryA modern office environment in Brunn am Gebirge (Campus 21/near SCS) is waiting for youOf course, you will receive a competitive compensation package based on your experience, which we will be happy to discuss with you personally. For the sake of completeness, however, we would like to mention that the minimum salary package starts at a gross yearly salary of around EUR 32,200.  One application a billion opportunities!We look forward to receiving your application: dimoco-payments.com/career/support-engineer/   DIMOCO Payments GmbH Kerstin Günes
Human Resources
Campus 21, Europaring F15/302
A-2345 Brunn/Gebirge
T: 0043-1-33 66 888-0
W: dimoco-payments.com/career/

Das Know-how reicht vom Sensor bis zur Künstlichen Intelligenz. Unsere Kernkompetenz sind dabei ineinander abgestimmte und durchgängig digitalisierte Prozessabläufe. Mit über 150 Software-Mitarbeitern sowie 25 Jahren Erfahrung begeistern wir Kunden aus unterschiedlichsten Branchen weltweit. Bewirb dich jetzt bei STIWA Software!Deine Rolle im Team:Konzeption und Implementierung von skalierbare Architekturen für komplexe, schreibintensive ApplikationenMöglichkeit, die Architektur in einer frühen Phase maßgeblich zu beeinflussenSicherstellung von Korrektheit, Zuverlässigkeit und Leistungsfähigkeit von Architektur und ApplikationenDu schaffst die Datenbasis für nachfolgende Analysen und AuswertungenDas bringst Du mit:Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in den Bereichen Informatik, Software Engineering oder ähnliche Fachrichtung (FH, UNI,) und mehrjährige Berufserfahrung notwendigDu hast ein gutes Verständnis und Wissen über aktuelle Big-Data-ArchitekturenErfahrung mit verteilten Technologien, insbesondere mit Apache KafkaDu weißt, wie man die Big Data 3 Vs (Volume, Velocity, Variety) "bändigt"Unsere Technologien, Sprachen & Frameworks:Java | Spring Boot | Apache Kafka | Apache Nifi | Oracle DB | MS SQL-Server | Windows | Linux | Docker | JetBrains Toolset Das erwartet dich:Diese Stelle ist wahlweise an unserer Niederlassung in Hagenberg i.M. oder in Wien zu besetzenEin Jahresbruttogehalt ab 46.346,72 (BSc) bzw. ab 56.068,12 (MSc., DI) nach dem KV Metallindustrie (38,5 Wochenstunden). Dein tatsächliches Gehalt richtet sich nach deiner Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation.Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Home Office MöglichkeitMitarbeiterrabatte, Firmenevents, betrieblicher Fahrkostenzuschuss und Vieles mehrWenn du Aufgaben entschlossen angehst und gerne im Team arbeitest, dann schick uns deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen (Lebenslauf mit Foto, inkl. Arbeits- und Ausbildungszeugnisse) an:STIWA Holding GmbHHuman Resources, Salzburger Straße 52, 4800 Attnang-PuchheimTel.: +43 7674 603-0 / E-Mail: jobs@stiwa.com / www.stiwa.com STIWA Holding GmbH Frau Daniela Kaml

Salzburger Straße 52
4800 Attnang-Puchheim

title: Relationship Manager / Industry Banker (all genders) Large Corporates bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text:
Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself Relationship Manager / Industry Banker (all genders) Large Corporates Location: Vienna Working-Hours: Full-time Occupation Area: Corporate banking Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment. In your role as Relationship Manager & Industry Advisor you will be a key team member of the Consumers Sector Team within the Large Corporates department with a focus on corporate clients in the subsectors including Retail, Food Value Chain, Healthcare and Agriculture. Our client service approach combines sector/industry specialization with regional intelligence and product expertise in order to be in the position to act as a trusted advisor for and to enter into a continuous strategic dialogue with the client’s decision makers. In this role you will represent the bank as the permanent face to the client headquarters and are responsible for all client-related activities along the deal value chain for the Consumers industry. You will be fully responsible for the overall financial result achieved with the defined client group portfolio and manage the associated risk, acting as a 1st line of defense for the bank. Inherent to the role is the responsibility for the definition of the client engagement and limit strategy, account planning and sales/deal tracking for the defined client portfolio. A key function is to foster cross-selling and a multi-product/multi-country approach based on a pro-active strategic dialogue with the client (i.e. trusted advisor role) in close collaboration with all relevant products, countries, risk management and other relevant internal stakeholders as well as coordinate deal teams. In your industry coverage role it is key to understand the industry and trends, growth, innovation and risk factors focusing on high business impact relevance for our region and translating this into concrete business leads and deals. Your Tasks As Relationship Manager you are the central point of contact for our corporate clients and are in direct and ongoing contact with customers (top management of large domestic & international companies)
Responsible for defining the client engagement and limit strategy for the respective client groups
New deal origination, negotiate terms and conditions, finalize loan and collateral documentation in cooperation with the legal department and other internal stakeholders
Contribute to the development of the Materials industry strategy across our group
Collaboration and alignment with all relevant internal stakeholders (product, CEE countries, risk management, legal …)
Preparation and presentation of screening notes and credit applications in the relevant committees as basis for the bank’s decision makers
Financial and market analysis for respective client portfolio and management of credit risk (“first line of defense”) Your Background University degree / master’s degree is an advantage
Thorough bank product knowledge
At least 3-4 years of experience in corporate banking or other relevant areas (currently Associate/VP level)
Confident in client situations and good analytical skills
Passion to focus on the Consumer industry and to work with corporate customers
Drive, enthusiasm, creativity, and excellent interpersonal skills with a motivation to work as a team player in multidisciplinary and cross-cultural transaction teams
Facilitate trust building and common sense, open minded & a communicative personality
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and in German, routine in negotiations; fluency in German being a prerequisite Our Offer We enable working in an international and diverse environment with special commitment towards the CEE region We provide state of the art working facilities at Erste Campus in Vienna Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 40.635,-- gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person! We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office. Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:
